content.description: Sit start with right hand crimp and left hand on a large rail. Climb up overhanging face trending left utilizing side pulls and decent features along left arete. Top out at the apex. Good climb with sustained difficulty throughout.
content.location: Right of main path leading to main slab area. Take a right (east) into the woods before reaching main slab area and walk towards a large hill. Problem will appear on your right when walking east. See map for more details.

content.description: Start on easy rail system right of Epley Maneuver. Climb up the highest part of the boulder. Gain higher feet and follow a series crimps, small rails, and little cracks to move up the rock and top out.
content.location: This climb will be in the middle of the rock between Black Vertigo and Cochlea. From small parking area near power lines, walk up the grassy hill until you see large slopey rock with a black streak down it.

content.description: Stand start matched on high side pull. Make your way up the face using good holds along the face and top out. Fun movement.
content.location: Right and up from of Fox Ear when looking at the boulder. In the second distinct valley after the main slab area, head west to find this climb just into the woods. Refer to the map for the area for more details.

content.description: Stand start on a good rail. Climb the face and top out on good holds.
content.location: Just north of the small talus field. From the main slab, walk north to the small talus field. Just around and to the right this boulder will border the tree line.

content.description: Start with slopey hands to make 1-2 moves onto good features to topout
content.location: Just before the talus along the powerline there is an atv trail that leads off the powerline to the East. Following the trail for ~75 feet will allow big wall to be seen to the Southeast. This route is on the west side of the big wall.

content.description: Stand start on jugs and follow prominent features for an easy topout. Landing is a slope that leads down a large hill.
content.location: Just past the patch of talus and right before the second set of powerline poles, the boulder is on the east side of the powerline (High side).

content.description: Sit start matched on a good rail. Climb up some fun balancy moves and top out
content.location: Left (East) of Death Spar when looking at the boulder. From the main slab continue north walking down the hill. Boulder will be to your right just into the woods once you reach a small valley.

content.description: Stand start with right hand side pull and left palm on a solid jug. Climb up the face then mantle/top out.
content.location: Right (west) of Death Spar. From the main slab, continue north and walk down the hill into a small valley. Boulder will be in the woods on your right once you get to the bottom of the valley.

content.description: Stand start with hands matched on pocket sort of ledge. Find your way to the giant jug out right and work your way up for an easy slab finish.
content.location: In the second distinct narrow valley after the main slab area, this route lies about 50 feet west of the west edge of the powerline. This route lies slightly southwest of cedar crack on the front side of the boulder that the route up from under is on. Refer to the map for details.

content.description: Sit start on low rail and move straight up with prominent features to comfortable topout.
content.location: To the right of low amperage on boulder behind main slab.

content.description: Sit start on good jugs. Climb up the face through interesting and balancy moves and top out.
content.location: Just above and to the right of the main slab.

content.description: Stand start with right hand arete and left hand sloper on the face. Climb up using the arete and small holds along the face. Top out using good jugs.
content.location: Below second level slab. Just before the talus along the powerline there is an atv trail that leads off the powerline to the East. Following the trail for ~75 feet will allow big wall to be seen to the Southeast.

content.description: Stand start matched on solid jug. Climb up tall face trending right and topout.
content.location: Left of Dragon Master Knight. From the main slab area, take a left into the woods. Trend left, and walking along a high slabby clifband. Take a right at gnome assassin and walk down the hill. Continue away from main slab area sticking towards left side of the cliff band/hill. Walk past Dragon Master Knight and problem will be on your left

content.description: Like the name implies, use the many juggy pocket features to climb up this rock for an easy top out.
content.location: Directly left of Dragon Scale and across the clearing from Gnome Assassin. Walk left into the woods from Black Vertigo, until you find a clearing. Walk across clearing past the the flakey feature of Dragon Scale.

content.description: Stand out right and head left and up. Crux is a high reach just past midway through the route.
content.location: Same boulder as Gnome's Salvation. First boulder after some bushwhacking directly left of the main boulder in the power-line clearing.

content.description: Travers the boulder to the right and finish up Gnome assassin.
content.location: First boulder found in small Valley directly L of the obvious boulders in the power-line clearing. Requires some bushwhacking.

content.description: Very fun V2. Start matched in a SDS on a low juggy rail. Climb up using lie-back/side pulls, before moving diagonally left to an obvious left hand jug in the middle of the wall. Easy top out.
content.location: On the same boulder, directly right of Dwarves Dismay and above Iron Treachery. Walk left once you reach the Black Vertigo Boulder. Keep moving that way. Go through the wooded area past Gnome Assassin and Dragon Master Knight. This boulder is up on a second level of forest above Iron Treachery. There will be multiple areas to hike up.

content.description: Sit start on two good crimps. Climb the overhanging route using holds along the face and left arete. Fun climb with a somewhat committing top out.
content.location: Right of cedar crack when looking at the boulder. See map of north boulders for more details.

content.description: Sit start on two crimps at the center of the boulder (same start as Fox Tail). Climb overhanging face trending right and top out. Fun problem with somewhat burly moves.
content.location: Right of Fox Tail when looking at the boulder. In the second distinct valley after the main slab area, head west to find this climb just barely into the woods. Continue past Cedar Crack after entering the woods. Refer to the map for the area for more details.

content.description: Start directly right of Black Vertigo on diagonal crack system. Climb up the rock using the crack and good slabby features.
content.location: Directly right of Black Vertigo. From small parking area near power lines, walk up the grassy hill until you see large slopey rock with a black streak down it.

content.description: SDS matched on crimpy rail. Climb up face trending right, and make a dynamic move to a prominent jug. Juggy holds make for an easing topout.
content.location: Left and above of Dragon Master Knight and directly above Iron Treachery. From the main slab area, take a left into the woods. Trend left, and walking along a high slabby clifband. Take a right at gnome assassin and walk down the hill. Continue away from main slab area sticking towards left side of the cliff band/hill. Continue past Dragon Master Knight, and walk up above the next cliff band. Problem will be on your left.

content.description: Stand start matched on good sidepull. Climb right utilizing flakey feature, then climb vertically utilizing arete and good holds along the face and topout.
content.location: Left of Gnome Assassin, problem will be on your right when walking away from main slab area. From the main slab area, take a left into the woods. Trend left, and walking along a high slabby clifband. Take a right at gnome assassin and walk down the hill. Continue away from main slab area, and problem will be on your right.

content.description: Stand start with feet and hands out right. Travers left and finish on Black Luster Soldier. V4/5 with the wrong beta or for shorter people. V3 with the proper beta and a normal height. Avoid Jar of Greed (Jug near the start).
content.location: Same boulder as Black Luster Soldier, further into the valley beyond Gnome Assassin. Boulder is above shelf on the left as you hike into the valley.

content.description: Stand start with hands on right edge features and make few simple moves onto mega jug right before top-out. Beware of 'death spar' below.
Start matched on good side pull. Climb the tall face and to a somewhat committing top out.
content.location: Left of Iron Treachery. Continue along the bluff past Iron Treachery until you see the tall face on your left.

content.description: From a stand, climb up the face trending left and top out. Beta felt a bit cryptic.
content.location: Just beyond the small talus field north of the main slab area. Walk past the main slab area until reaching the small talus field, then walk around to the north side and the boulder will be on your right.

content.description: Stand start on good hold at the base of the zig-zag crack. Climb up tall slab following the crack system. Fun movement with good holds throughout.
content.location: Far right route of the tall slab. Can be seen from the parking area. From the parking area, walk straight up the hill below the powerline to the tall slab.

content.description: Short route with a balancy/reachy finish.
content.location: Left aspect of signature boulder in the main clearing of the power-line area.

content.description: Sit start with left hand on low jug and right hand on low rail. Climb up using solid jugs and top out.
content.location: Leftmost line in Cedar Crack area. In the second distinct valley after the main slab area, head west to find this climb just barely into the woods. Refer to the map for the area for more details.

content.description: Start standing with side pull for the right hand and crimp for the left hand. Make a big move for the large ledge and work your way up using good hand holds to get the feet onto the ledge for an easy topout. Big move favors climbers with reach.
content.location: To the right of cedar crack. Refer to the map in north boulders area for more details.

content.description: Sit start on good ledges for climb filled with great holds. The top has a close tree to be aware of when topping out.
content.location: In the second distinct valley after the main slab area, head west to find this climb just barely into the woods. Directly to the left of cedar crack. Refer to the map for the area for more details.

content.description: From a stand, climb up using the crack and prominent holds on the face, then top out.
content.location: From the main slab, continue north along the powerline. Continue past the valley with the Death Spar boulder, and this boulder will be on your left just into the woods. If you reach the talus, you’ve gone too far. See North Boulders map for more details.

content.description: Climb up slabby ladder system of jugs and great feet left of black streak. Easy climb, but good warm up for the rest of the problems next to it.
content.location: Left of Black Vertigo there is a nice system of jugs. From small parking area near power lines, walk up the grassy hill until you see large slopey rock with a black streak down it.

content.description: Bail out of Dragon Master Knight with the use of Jar of Greed to top out just left of the start.
content.location: Located above a shelf to the left as you hike into the small valley.

content.description: Stand start matched on prominent ledge. Climb up aesthetic black streak trending right. Holds become less prominent near the top.
content.location: Middle of main slab. Can be seen from the parking area. From the parking area, walk straight up the hill below the powerline to the tall slab.

content.description: Sit start on far left side and traverse out right and then up obvious in-cuts at tallest portion of boulder.
content.location: Further into the Valley, well past the Gnome Boulder. Sits on a large ledge with a ramp like approach from the right.

content.description: From Carney Lake road, the powerline offers easy access to developed boulders. The main slab area can be seen from the parking area, but many other problems can be found by hiking left into the woods from the main slab area. Most developed problems are within 10 minutes from the parking area, but the area is far from fully developed and should be continued to be explored. Problems arranged from left to right as if looking at main slab area.
